channel.title: RuneSource - iClarity
channel.description:
[CENTER][IMG]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/2505112/iClarity%20banner.jpg[/img][/CENTER]
This is iClarity; based off RuneSource. It's currently just a starting point for people wanting to use RuneSource as a base, but want a little more content to get started. I'm going to develop this further and further until, eventually, it's a finished server.
Download: [url=http://dl.dropbox.com/u/2505112/iClarity/iClarity.zip]Click here[/url].
[U][SIZE=12pt][B]Features[/B][/SIZE][/U]
All the standard features from RuneSource can be found [url=http://"http://www.google.org/runescape-development/google/projects/276272-runesource-317-a.html"]here[/url].
[ul][li]Good class/object structure.[/li] [li]All features that the standard RuneSource base has.[/li] [li]Blake's "Event Executor" tweaked by myself to run on server cycles - several features use this.[/li] [li]Graphic, animation, and entity-facing update flags for players added.[/li] [li]Npc updating completed (Update flags still to be added).[/li] [li]Walking-to-entity actions. This is a feature that executes an action after the player has walked/runned to an entity (Npc, object or ground item).[/li] [li]Perfect, fully functional dialogue system.[/li] [li]Item/Npc definitions, Npc spawns and dialogues loaded via XML.[/li] [li]Player bonuses.[/li] [li]Ground item system - ground items reload when you enter a new region, taking into account if they are tradeable and who the ground items belong to, as to whether they show to the player. Stackable items work perfectly.[/li] [li]Basic teleportation system.[/li] [li]Item container system - the player's inventory uses this; banking, trading, and shopping will also implement this.[/li][/ul]
[U][SIZE=12pt][B]Images[/B][/SIZE][/U]
Dialogues: [IMG]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/2505112/iClarity/dialogue.jpg[/img]
Ground items: [IMG]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/2505112/iClarity/grounditems.jpg[/img]
Equipment bonuses: [IMG]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/2505112/iClarity/bonuses.jpg[/img]
[U][B][SIZE=12pt]In the next version I hope to have:[/SIZE][/B][/U]
[ul][li]All remaining player/npc update flags added.[/li] [li]Banking.[/li] [li]Trading.[/li] [li]Shopping.[/li] [li]1-2 skills.[/li] [li]Magic teleportation.[/li] [li]More use of objects such as doors, teleportation objects, etc.[/li] [li]Any others that I feel like adding, or I feel are imperitive to have before working on the [b]real[/b] content.[/li][/ul]
Credits:
[ul][li]blakeman8192 - Great base, great guy. He provided RuneSource and has helped me with bits and pieces :). [/li][/ul]

item.dc:creator: @Scully Scully
item.description:
@Scully wrote:

[quote=“James_Akins, post:15, topic:383467”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=479242.msg3509202#msg3509202 date=1298418494]

ummm wtf… i cant seem to find how to activeate turmoil… and wheres godwars?

I have compiled a very thorough yet simple list for you to follow.
1: Click turmoil.

there aint even turmoil… facepalm ur so dumb. and there aint even godwars wat is this…
[/quote]A REAL 317 with no hard coded SHIT.

wtf u dont have to be so mean…[/quote]
And you don’t have to be so stupid…

on topic: Good job Prima.

item.title: RuneSource - iClarity
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Xata27:

Question: Which client did you use?

I Vain I:

317 deob.

This.

It’s all I need for the moment, and it may be all I ever need. I really don’t see the point in adding newer content to an already perfect client. If I wanted to do that; I’d create a higher revision server.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneSource - iClarity
item.dc:creator: @Vengpwe Vengpwe
item.description:
@Vengpwe wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:30, topic:383467”][quote author=Vengpwe link=topic=479242.msg3511128#msg3511128 date=1298584977]

I got the eclipse now but how can i set it up? i never worked with it before, i do creat new java project but don’t know how to connect the source to it.

You just create a new Java project with existing sources, then link the source to the folder of the server you downloaded.

Looks a lot like… Azure, that BFMV released on r-s… Hm.

If you actually read the codes rather than just look at pictures, you’d realize that they are very different. Anyways; why would I take a source, remove content and then release it as my own? That’s just retarded.

Azure initial release, released before the full version, had these exact features… But, mk.
[/quote]What fucking server doesn’t have walking and talking?

Umad?

Udumb?
I’m sure if he didn’t say “fucking” you wouldn’t have even said anything.[/quote]

Umad?

Read full topic
